auth.description: This section configures how to generate the certificates and private keys

certificate.description: The output name of the certificate in the auth folder

key.description: The output name of the private key in the auth folder

pkcs8.description: The output name of the pkcs8 file in the auth folder

rootCACertificate.description: The path to the root certificate

rootCAKey.description: The path to the root private key

version.description: The version of the corpus data

local.description: If local is true, use this only when running via servicerator otherwise use it within a task definition

cpu_core_count.description: The number of CPU cores available to the container

environment_variables.description: A list of environment variables set for this container

local.description: If local is true, use this only when running via servicerator otherwise use it within a task definition

prod.description: If prod is true, use this only when creating a production a task definition

memory_limit.description: The memory available to the container (in megabytes)

ports.description: A list of port bindings set for this container, define local dev bindings here as well as task definition bindings

container.description: The exposed port on the container

host.description: The port to use on the host machine

local.description: If local is true, use this only when running via servicerator otherwise use it within a task definition

volumes.description: A list of volume mounts set for this container, define local dev volume mounts here as well as task definition volume mounts

container.description: The volume name within the container

host.description: The full path of the host volume

local.description: If local is true, use this only when running via servicerator otherwise use it within a task definition

name.description: The name of this volume mount

read_only.description: Set if volume is read only

organization.description: The organization associated with the docker account

password.description: The docker password associated with the docker account

username.description: The docker user name associated with the docker account

contents.description: The contents of the file, every item represents a line

destination.description: The destination of the copy operation

on_close.description: Set to true to run this operation on servicerator close

on_open.description: Set to true to run this operation on servicerator open

on_setup.description: Set to true to run this operation when running servicertator setup

overwrite.description: Set to true to overwrite file/folder

source.description: The source of the copy operation

version.description: The version subfolder within your bucket

dynamic.description: Set dynamic to true if you want to keep the model version that is currently running already

clusters.description: A list of clusters for the service

health_check_grace_period.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that Auto Scaling waits before checking the health status of an EC2 instance that has come into service

name.description: The name of the Auto Scaling group. This name must be unique within the scope of your AWS account

count.description: The number of instances in this auto scaling group

subnets.description: A list of subnet identifiers for your VPC

access_key.description: The AWS Access Key associated with a user

name.description: The bucket name, without the s3:// prefix

permissions.description: The permissions that should be associated with the username

username.description: The bucket user that has read access to the bucket

assume_role.description: The AWS role to assume with the provided profile

role_arn.description: The role used for federated login

principal_arn.description: The principal used for federated login

session_headers.description: Headers to set for SAML session

session_url.description: The URL for initiating the session

policy_url.description: The policy URL that serves the users roles

otka_org_url.description: The url of your Okta org

okta_aws_app_url.description: The url link of your Okta AWS application url

username_prompt_text.description: Replace the default prompt for username entry

password_prompt_text.description: Replace the default prompt for password entry

secret_key.description: The AWS Secret Key associated with a user

service_role.description: The AWS service role to use

default.description: Specifiy if this is the default cluster you would deploy too when not providing a specific cluster as an argument

environment.description: The name of the cluster environment

identity_file.description: The name of the Amazon EC2 key pair

ami.description: The name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance profile associated with the IAM role for the instance, check https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/ecs-optimized_AMI_launch_latest.html

assign_public_ip.description: Assign a public IP address to this instance

iam_role.description: The IAM role for this instance

tags.description: A list of tags against the instance

type.description: The instance type of the Amazon EC2 instance

user_data.description: The user data to make available to the launched Amazon EC2 instances, each list item represents a line

DeviceName.description: The name of the device within Amazon EC2

Ebs.description: The Elastic Block Storage volume information

DeleteOnTermination.description: Indicates whether to delete the volume on instance termination

Encrypted.description: Indicates whether the volume is encrypted. Encrypted Amazon EBS volumes can only be attached to instance types that support Amazon EBS encryption.

SnapshotId.description: The snapshot ID of the volume to use to create a block device

name.description: The name of the launch configuration. This name must be unique within the scope of your AWS account

security_groups.description: One or more security groups with which to associate the instances

healthy_threshold.description: The number of consecutive health checks successes required before moving the instance to the Healthy state

interval.description: The approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an individual instance

target.description: The instance being checked. The protocol is either TCP, HTTP, HTTPS, or SSL. The range of valid ports is one (1) through 65535

timeout.description: The amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a failed health check

unhealthy_threshold.description: The number of consecutive health check failures required before moving the instance to the Unhealthy state

name.description: The name of the load balancer

instance_port.description: The port of the instance running behind the load balancer

instance_protocol.description: The port of the instance running behind the load balancer

load_balancer_port.description: The port exposed on the load balancer

protocol.description: The protocol used by the load balancer

ssl_certificate_id.description: The ARN of the certificate ID

security_groups.description: The IDs of the security groups to assign to the load balancer

subnets.description: The IDs of the subnets in your VPC to attach to the load balancer

tags.description: A list of tags to assign to the load balancer

count.description: The number of tasks to run on the cluster service

minimum_count.description: The minumum number of tasks to run on the cluster service

maximum_count.description: The maximum number of tasks to run on the cluster service

name.description: The name of the target group

role.description: The AWS role of the cluster service

service_name.description: The name of the service running on the cluster

url.description: The URL for the service in this cluster

vpc_name.description: The name of the VPC this cluster is running in

contents.description: The contents of the file, every item represents a line

destination.description: The destination of the copy operation

on_close.description: Set to true to run this operation on servicerator close

on_open.description: Set to true to run this operation on servicerator open

on_setup.description: Set to true to run this operation when running servicertator setup

overwrite.description: Set to true to overwrite file/folder

source.description: The source of the copy operation

short_name.description: The short name of this service, used for the service url
